brief: Specialization for when T is a reference.
details: optional<T&> acts similarly to a T*, but provides more operations and shows intent more clearly. _Examples_: ```cpp int i = 42; thrust::optional o = i; *o == 42; //true i = 12; *o = 12; //true &*o == &i; //true ``` Assignment has rebind semantics rather than assign-through semantics: ```cpp int j = 8; o = j; &*o == &j; //true ```
name: optional< T & >

publicFunctions.brief: \group and_then Carries out some operation which returns an optional on the stored object if there is one.
publicFunctions.name: and_then
returns: Let U be the result of std::invoke(std::forward<F>(f), value()). Returns a std::optional<U>. The return value is empty if *this is empty, otherwise the return value of std::invoke(std::forward<F>(f), value()) is returned. \group and_then \synopsis template \nconstexpr auto and_then(F &&f) &;
publicFunctions.summary: \group and_then Carries out some operation which returns an optional on the stored object if there is one.
publicFunctions.title: and_then

publicFunctions.title: and_then

publicFunctions.name: and_then

publicFunctions.brief: Carries out some operation on the stored object if there is one.
publicFunctions.details: \group map \synopsis template <class F> constexpr auto map(F &&f) &;
publicFunctions.name: map
returns: Let U be the result of std::invoke(std::forward<F>(f), value()). Returns a std::optional<U>. The return value is empty if *this is empty, otherwise an optional<U> is constructed from the return value of std::invoke(std::forward<F>(f), value()) and is returned.
publicFunctions.summary: Carries out some operation on the stored object if there is one.
publicFunctions.title: map

publicFunctions.brief: \group map \synopsis template <class F> constexpr auto map(F &&f) &&;
publicFunctions.name: map
publicFunctions.summary: \group map \synopsis template <class F> constexpr auto map(F &&f) &&;
publicFunctions.title: map

publicFunctions.title: map

publicFunctions.name: map
publicFunctions.summary: \group map \synopsis template <class F> constexpr auto map(F &&f) const&&;
publicFunctions.title: map

publicFunctions.brief: Calls f if the optional is empty \requires std::invoke_result_t<F> must be void or convertible to optional<T>.
publicFunctions.details: \effects If *this has a value, returns *this. Otherwise, if f returns void, calls std::forward<F>(f) and returns std::nullopt. Otherwise, returns std::forward<F>(f)(). \group or_else \synopsis template optional or_else (F &&f) &;
publicFunctions.name: or_else
publicFunctions.summary: Calls f if the optional is empty \requires std::invoke_result_t<F> must be void or convertible to optional<T>.
publicFunctions.title: or_else

publicFunctions.details: \effects If *this has a value, returns *this. Otherwise, if f returns void, calls std::forward<F>(f) and returns std::nullopt. Otherwise, returns std::forward<F>(f)(). \group or_else \synopsis template optional or_else (F &&f) &;
publicFunctions.name: or_else
publicFunctions.title: or_else

publicFunctions.brief: \group or_else \synopsis template <class F> optional<T> or_else (F &&f) const &;
publicFunctions.name: or_else
publicFunctions.summary: \group or_else \synopsis template <class F> optional<T> or_else (F &&f) const &;
publicFunctions.title: or_else

publicFunctions.brief: Maps the stored value with f if there is one, otherwise returns u.
publicFunctions.details: If there is a value stored, then f is called with **this and the value is returned. Otherwise u is returned. \group map_or
publicFunctions.name: map_or
publicFunctions.summary: Maps the stored value with f if there is one, otherwise returns u.
publicFunctions.title: map_or

publicFunctions.brief: Maps the stored value with f if there is one, otherwise calls u and returns the result.
publicFunctions.details: If there is a value stored, then f is called with **this and the value is returned. Otherwise std::forward<U>(u)() is returned. \group map_or_else \synopsis template \nauto map_or_else(F &&f, U &&u) &;
publicFunctions.name: map_or_else
publicFunctions.summary: Maps the stored value with f if there is one, otherwise calls u and returns the result.
publicFunctions.title: map_or_else

publicFunctions.brief: \group map_or_else \synopsis template <class F, class U>\nauto map_or_else(F &&f, U &&u) &&;
publicFunctions.name: map_or_else
publicFunctions.summary: \group map_or_else \synopsis template <class F, class U>\nauto map_or_else(F &&f, U &&u) &&;
publicFunctions.title: map_or_else

publicFunctions.name: map_or_else
publicFunctions.summary: \group map_or_else \synopsis template <class F, class U>\nauto map_or_else(F &&f, U &&u) const &;
publicFunctions.title: map_or_else

publicFunctions.name: map_or_else
publicFunctions.summary: \group map_or_else \synopsis template <class F, class U>\nauto map_or_else(F &&f, U &&u) const &&;
publicFunctions.title: map_or_else

publicFunctions.summary: Takes the value out of the optional, leaving it empty \group take.

publicFunctions.name: optional
publicFunctions.summary: Constructs an optional that does not contain a value.

publicFunctions.details: If rhs contains a value, the stored value is direct-initialized with it. Otherwise, the constructed optional is empty.

publicFunctions.details: If rhs contains a value, the stored value is direct-initialized with it. Otherwise, the constructed optional is empty.

publicFunctions.details: Destroys the current value if there is one.

publicFunctions.details: Rebinds this optional to the referee of rhs if there is one. Otherwise resets the stored value in *this.
publicFunctions.name: operator=

publicFunctions.details: \requires U must be an lvalue reference. \synopsis optional &operator=(U &&u);

publicFunctions.details: Rebinds this optional to the referee of rhs if there is one. Otherwise resets the stored value in *this.

publicFunctions.brief: Constructs the value in-place, destroying the current one if there is one.
publicFunctions.name: emplace

publicFunctions.title: emplace

publicFunctions.brief: Swaps this optional with the other.
publicFunctions.details: If neither optionals have a value, nothing happens. If both have a value, the values are swapped. If one has a value, it is moved to the other and the movee is left valueless.
publicFunctions.name: swap
publicFunctions.summary: Swaps this optional with the other.
publicFunctions.title: swap
